div.pre: 2071 Monte Bubbonia, 25 km. N of Gela, (188 = 667) 1910 Burial: 475-70 B.C. (Jenkins), but see note below Contents: 338 AR Rhegium: 4 tetradr. (mule-car) Acragas: 78 didr. Camarina: 1 didr. Gela: 7 tetradr. (to Jenkins 178) 61 didr. Himera: 5 didr. (rev. crab) 1 dr. (rev. hen) Leontini: 2 tetradr. (obv. galloping qua- driga) Zancle: 2 dr. Messana: 5 tetradr. (mule-car) Selinus: 30 didr. (obv. leaf) Syracuse: 61 tetradr. (to Boehringer 333) 3 didr. 6 dr. Acanthus: 1 tetradr. Athens: 6 tetradr. (archaic) Disposition: Syracuse 273 as listed Orsi, NSc 1912, pp. 454-5 Currò Pisanò, AIIN 1962-4, pp. 223, 237 (listed as 1910 = Caltagirone) Jenkins, Gela, pp. 22-4, 154 This hd. has previously been named either Caltagirone or Mazzarino; for Monte Bubbonia as the find-spot, see Jenkins, p. 154 The date of burial should perhaps be lowered to c. 465 B.C. or after; the Syracusan series terminates at about the same point as that of no. 2076 below, for which a date of burial at least some years after 470 B.C. is required by the latest issues of Himera included therein
